abstract: Dainippon Sumitomo Pharma of Japan said Thursday that it would buy the American drug maker Sepracor for $2.6 billion, as it seeks to tap sales in the United States and expand the products in its pipeline.
snippet: Dainippon Sumitomo Pharma of Japan said Thursday that it would buy the American drug maker Sepracor for $2.6 billion, as it seeks to tap sales in the United States and expand the products in its pipeline.
lead_paragraph: Dainippon Sumitomo Pharma of Japan said Thursday that it would buy the American drug maker Sepracor for $2.6 billion, as it seeks to tap sales in the United States and expand the products in its pipeline, Chris V. Nicholson reported for The New York Times.

headline.main: Drug Maker Dainippon to Buy Sepracor for $2.6 Billion
